column5: Funny how a trip to the tackle shop for a 24$ fishing licence costs $90.  Anyway, has anyone used one of these Arctic Warrior Tip ups from Clamcorp?  How do you like it?  Where does the spring fit on the base?  Thanks in advance.
I have just bought one, I haven't tried it yet, I'm hoping to give it a go on Sunday.  I'll let you know.  HF
bought one last season works great......make sure u balance the rod perfect a lot of the time the wind will set it off if its to front heavy
Could you post a picture of it?

They are on sale at Basspro for..........................$17.00...........yep the price is rite  They are on clearance, the best deal today was the flanel jeans mmmmmmmmmmmmmm can you say toasty  I spent 75 bucks on some great stuff
I know why douG bought one of those heheheheh... for the meet and greets!!! don't spill your apple juice douG!!

That's a pretty snazzy lookin' Tip Up there, I'd be interested to know how they work for my next trip to the Great White Frozen North.  $24 for a fishin' license? That's outrageous! Ours are $9.50, but we're backwards backwoods Rednecks and don't have alot of money like y'all Canadian millionaires do... oh that's right, I don't even buy fishin' licenses anymore...
There is talk of raising our minimum wage to $10.00/hour cdn. What is the minimum wage your way?

Democrats are trying to raise it from $5.xx to $7.xx A lofty goal and will be difficult for businesses... Republicans are crying in thier Martinis, I feel for them. Here's a thought, had Republicans bumped the minimum wage on a regular basis over the last eight years to mirror COL increases, there wouldn't be such an outcry from low wage employers. Who am I kidding.  But I digress...  I'd be willing to pay more for my fishing privlidges if I were certain that the money was going directly back into the MNR.  Wait, what was this topic about? Oh yeah Tip-Ups.... don't they have better methods for catching baitfish? -Brian
